ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: as an excellent introduction to medieval sculpture and the issues that have driven the scholarship on this topic in the field of art history. I would recommend it to another student.

Would definitely recommend the course to anyone interested in the Middle Ages, or in the methodologies of art history. Especially important for introducing students to the most contemporary ideas offered in medieval scholarship, involving ideas of reception theory and the embodied viewer.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course deepened my knowledge of medieval art considerably. It contributed to how I think about the material culture of the medieval world.

Very influential on my own thinking methodologically, in that the course made me think about the ways in which viewing and understanding artworks may relate directly to the beholder's own position in space.
